keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has proposed rules that would help consumers fight back against excessive fees on consumer financial products.

headline.print_headline: Bank Customers Get a Fighting Chance
headline.main: Bank Customers Get a Fighting Chance

snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has proposed rules that would help consumers fight back against excessive fees on consumer financial products.
abstract: Editorial supports rules proposed by Consumer Financial Protection Bureau that would prohibit forced arbitration clauses in consumer financial product contracts banning class-action lawsuits; holds rule would provide means of recourse to consumers victimized by predatory banks and credit card companies; calls ban hallmark of anti-regulatory era that led to financial crisis.
